approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: To create a portal/dashboard for V-KYC team leads to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit purposes.
project_goals: Provide V-KYC team leads with access to V-KYC recordings.
Enable easy retrieval of recordings for audit requirements.
Reduce dependency on IT for accessing recordings.
approval_data.business_context: The V-KYC team currently relies on the IT data server team to provide recordings. This manual process is time-consuming and inefficient. This project aims to streamline the process by providing a self-service portal for accessing recordings.

requirements.description: A portal/dashboard should be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal should be provided to the leads of VKYC process (TL & Process Manager).
All V-KYC recordings should be available on the portal.
Recordings should be fetched as and when required.
Recordings should be searchable by LAN ID.
Recordings should be available date and month wise.
An option to upload an Excel or text file with LAN IDs should be available on the portal.
The system should process the file and trigger a call to the backend API.
Results should be displayed in a tabular format with a 'Download All' option.
The table should have pagination displaying only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records should be downloaded at a time.
The file upload should accept csv/txt files.
The access for the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team leaders)

functional_requirements: Date and month-wise filtering of recordings.
Bulk download functionality (up to 50 LAN IDs).
Display of recording details (User ID, Call Duration, Status, Time, Date, NFS VKYC Upload Time).
non_functional_requirements: The system should be accessible only to authorized users (Team Leads).
The system should handle file uploads of up to 50 LAN IDs.
The system should have a user-friendly interface.
success_criteria: V-KYC team leads can access and download recordings independently.
Reduction in time taken to retrieve recordings.
constraints: Recordings are stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server.
File upload should be csv/txt file.
The table pagination will display only 10 records at a time , and similarly only 10 records at a time will be downloaded .
assumptions: The existing infrastructure (NFS server) will be available.
The backend API for processing requests will be available.
risks: Technical challenges in accessing and retrieving recordings from the NFS server.
Security risks related to unauthorized access to recordings.
Performance issues due to large file sizes or high user load.

recommendations: Define the specific security measures to protect the recordings.
Specify the performance requirements for the portal (e.g., response time).
Elaborate on the error handling and reporting mechanisms.

identified_gaps: Specific security requirements are not explicitly defined.
Error handling and reporting mechanisms are not detailed.
recommendations_for_completion: Define security requirements (e.g., access controls, encryption).
Specify performance requirements (e.g., response time, concurrent users).
Detail the error handling and reporting mechanisms.
